intro: Rhinotropis nudata, commonly known as the naked sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairless, and it produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Rhinotropis nudata is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in open habitats such as dunes or disturbed areas.
